scripts.gitSync: pnpm typeorm:drop && pnpm migration:run && pnpm seed

scriptsComments.dev: Starts the development server using vite-plugin-node for rapid iteration.
scriptsComments.startProd: Runs the built app in production mode. Note this requires globally-installed npm package http-server (pnpm i -g http-server).
scriptsComments.typeorm: Necessary for updateDatasource to function properly, as it expects a discrete script named typeorm
scriptsComments.buildJS: Builds standard JS files via tsc-esm, which we use for typeorm CLI and migrations
scriptsComments.typeorm:drop: pnpm buildJS && Resets typeorm's internal idea of your database's state as well as dropping all tables in the database if they exist.  Use with caution!
scriptsComments.typeorm:sync: pnpm buildJS && Syncs database to current Models state, like synchronize: true in our datasources, but on-demand
scriptsComments.typeorm:updateDatasource: pnpm buildJS && Updates the typeorm datasource file with the latest references to your models, migrations, etc. Run after migration:generate or migration:create
scriptsComments.migration:run: Runs all pending migrations, use after typeorm:updateDatasource
scriptsComments.migration:create: Creates new migration for manual entry, used like > pnpm migration:create ./src/db/migrations/MyNewMigrationName.  Run typeorm:updateDatasource after this to update the datasource file.
scriptsComments.migrations:generate: Auto-generates a new migration based on any entity changes you made to your JS files, used like > pnpm migration:generate ./src/db/migrations/IpHistoryAddMethod  Run typeorm:updateDatasource after this to update the datasource file.
scriptsComments.migration:revert: Undoes the most recent migration, can be called multiple times in a row
scriptsComments.seed: Starts petorpass in seed mode (Create default database entries), used like > pnpm seed
scriptsComments.generateDocs: Auto generates a doc site from JSDoc comments in your code after building
scriptsComments.gitSync: Run this immediately after 'git pull' to update your local database to match the new commit
